# issue: old pkgs don't have a go.mod file; use symlinks workaround

cd mod1

exec go mod tidy
#exec go run main.go

ucmd godebugtester run main.go
#ucmd godebugtester run -work -srclines=false -verbose main.go

-- mod1/go.mod --
module mod1
require github.com/davecgh/go-spew v1.1.1
require rsc.io/pdf v0.1.1

-- mod1/main.go --
package main

//godebug:annotateimport
import "rsc.io/pdf"
//godebug:annotateimport
import "github.com/davecgh/go-spew/spew"
//godebug:annotateimport
import "golang.org/x/tools/godoc"

func main(){
	_,_=pdf.Open("somename")
	_=godoc.RangeSelection("aaa")
}
